life_history: The client has a history of substance abuse and has been through rehab. He has faced emotional neglect and rejection from his mother and has had issues with his family. He has struggled with obesity since childhood, which has negatively affected his self-esteem and body image. He has also been victimized and bullied due to his weight.
core_belief_description: Helpless: I am trapped. I am out of control.
Unlovable: I am unlovable. I am undesirable, unwanted.
intermediate_beliefs: Helpless: I'm just not very good at handling stress and I have poor self-control, which is why I need to not put myself in stressful situations.
Unlovable: If I show my true self, people will reject me the way my mother rejected me.
intermediate_beliefs_during_depression: Helpless: There's nothing I can do to change my situation. I cannot control myself.
Unlovable: I don't deserve to be happy, so why even try to stay clean?
coping_strategies: I uses avoidance as a coping strategy by distancing himself from family to minimize exposure to negativity and conflict. I also schedule pleasant activities and plans his day to maintain a sense of control.

cognitive_models.situation: My cousin invited him to attend his upcoming wedding.
cognitive_models.automatic_thoughts: It will be stressful and negative; people will ask me questions I cannot answer or don't want to answer; my mum would be ashamed of me and critical of me as always; they don't want me there anyway, nobody likes me in this family.
cognitive_models.emotion: anxious, worried, fearful, scared, tense; sad, down, lonely, unhappy
cognitive_models.behavior: Ignored the invitation and did not respond to the RSVP request. Ignored phone calls from family.
